name: Modernizing a Classic... Painted Poppies
description:
“Modernizing a Classic… Painted Poppies” Artist: Faye Hoch Dimensions: 34x41 inches Artist’s Statement: Many of IKEA's fabrics are modern in design and color. IKEA merchandise in genereal can create an interior that suggest a modern design. I interpreted a classic from the art world, a painted pot of poppies, to be modern and hip. Just as the traditional quilt world has changed to incorporate art quilts, what was a standard painted motif, has come a long way to be a part of our current artistic aesthetic. This quilt was awarded Best of Show in the Project Patchwork IKEA Challenge.
This quilt was created as part of Project Patchwork, a partnership between IKEA and Textile Center. Artists were challenged to make an art quilt using only IKEA fabrics. Proceeds from the sale of these quilts go to benefit the Textile Center's Youth Education Programs. See the right sidebar on this page to learn more about the project.

name: Wind
description:
“Wind” Artist: Betsy Shannon Dimensions: 21x40 inches Artist’s Statement: The wind turbine farms that I see as I travel back and forth for my fabric and bead store in Iowa. The turbines are silent and majestic as they collect clean energy in the midst of wild flowers and farm crops. Awarded "First Place" in Project Patchwork Challenge.
This quilt was created as part of Project Patchwork, a partnership between IKEA and Textile Center. Artists were challenged to make an art quilt using only IKEA fabrics. Proceeds from the sale of these quilts go to benefit the Textile Center's Youth Education Programs. See the right sidebar on this page to learn more about the project.

name: Life is a Puzzle
description:
“Life is a Puzzle” Artist: Cyndi Kaye Meier Dimensions: 32x31 inches Artist’s Statement: My inspiration came from the colors in the fabric. The large puzzle piece motifs in orange and blue inspired me to deconstruct the puzzle and reconstruct a vertical motif.
This quilt was created as part of Project Patchwork, a partnership between IKEA and Textile Center. Artists were challenged to make an art quilt using only IKEA fabrics. Proceeds from the sale of these quilts go to benefit the Textile Center's Youth Education Programs. See the right sidebar on this page to learn more about the project.

name: Random Panes
description:
“Random Panes” Artist: Debra Svedberg Dimensions: 24x24 inches Artist’s Statement: The geometric shapes on the fabric by Linda Svensson looked like architecture to me.
This quilt was created as part of Project Patchwork, a partnership between IKEA and Textile Center. Artists were challenged to make an art quilt using only IKEA fabrics. Proceeds from the sale of these quilts go to benefit the Textile Center's Youth Education Programs. See the right sidebar on this page to learn more about the project.
